newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish Nov yr/yr CPI up 2.4 pct (EU method).
newsitem.headline: Danish Nov yr/yr CPI up 2.4 pct (EU method).

text.p: Danish consumer prices were unchanged in November from October but were 2.4 percent higher than in November 1995, the National Statistics Office said on Thursday.

The CPI data was issued under new EU-harmonised calculation methods. Under the traditional Danish national formula the respective figures would have risen 0.2 percent month-on-month and 2.4 percent year-on-year.
NEW EU FORMULA Nov 1996 Oct 1996 Nov 1995
NOTE - Average analyst expectations were for a 2.4 percent rise from November 1995 according to the national formula. -- Steve Weizman, Copenhagen Newsroom +45-33-969650
